trans-unit.source: How to: Discover and Expose a Service Bus Service
trans-unit.target: How to: Discover and Expose a Service Bus Service

trans-unit.source: Once a service has been deployed to a <token>sb2</token> endpoint, you can create a client to connect to that service.
trans-unit.target: Once a service has been deployed to a <token>sb2</token> endpoint, you can create a client to connect to that service.

trans-unit.source: However, in order to do this, you must first know the URI of the service, which you can discover in one of two ways:
trans-unit.target: However, in order to do this, you must first know the URI of the service, which you can discover in one of two ways:

trans-unit.source: The creator of the service can explicitly provide the URI.
trans-unit.target: The creator of the service can explicitly provide the URI.

trans-unit.source: You can discover the address by navigating the naming hierarchy of the <token>servicensd</token> under which the service has been published.
trans-unit.target: You can discover the address by navigating the naming hierarchy of the <token>servicensd</token> under which the service has been published.

trans-unit.source: This second step occurs through the service registry, which is a database of services and their associated URIs.
trans-unit.target: This second step occurs through the service registry, which is a database of services and their associated URIs.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> exposing an endpoint in the service registry, see <link xlink:href="69553490-bb60-46e7-aca2-b8aac8952d2b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Publish a Service to the AppFabric Service Bus Registry</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> exposing an endpoint in the service registry, see <link xlink:href="69553490-bb60-46e7-aca2-b8aac8952d2b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Publish a Service to the AppFabric Service Bus Registry</link>.

trans-unit.source: To discover a service that has been published in the service registry
trans-unit.target: To discover a service that has been published in the service registry

trans-unit.source: You can discover a published service by navigating the naming hierarchy, which can be accessed through a nested tree of Atom 1.0 feeds.
trans-unit.target: You can discover a published service by navigating the naming hierarchy, which can be accessed through a nested tree of Atom 1.0 feeds.

trans-unit.source: The root feed for a given project is located at <codeInline>http://%%amp;lt;service-namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/ </codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The root feed for a given project is located at <codeInline>http://%%amp;lt;service-namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/ </codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Note that, by default, services are "cloaked," and not visible in the Atom feed.
trans-unit.target: Note that, by default, services are "cloaked," and not visible in the Atom feed.

trans-unit.source: A developer must explicitly decide to make the service visible.
trans-unit.target: A developer must explicitly decide to make the service visible.

trans-unit.source: However, cloaking only makes a service invisible in the Atom feed; any client that has the necessary credentials can still connect to the service if it knows the address.
trans-unit.target: However, cloaking only makes a service invisible in the Atom feed; any client that has the necessary credentials can still connect to the service if it knows the address.
